intro: Eleocharis setacea, commonly known as the tufted spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and streams. The plant has slender, grass-like stems that are often covered in fine, bristly hairs. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, which are small, cylindrical flower clusters. Eleocharis setacea plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
